cities.name: Beograd

cities.local_food_tip: Try ƒáevapi or pljeskavica with kajmak and ajvar at a local kafana. For dessert, order palaƒçinke or krempita.

full_day.Morning: ‚òÄÔ∏è Start with a walk through Kalemegdan Fortress, then grab breakfast and coffee at Kafeterija Magazin 1907.

spring.description: Every April, thousands of runners fill the streets for Serbia‚Äôs biggest marathon event.

ideas.name: Ko≈°utnjak Forest Park

ideas.name: Ta≈°majdan Park

public_transport_tips.tip: Use the BusPlus card for all buses, trams, and trolleys.

cities.name: Kragujevac

spring.description: Local runners and visitors gather to race along the ƒêetinja River trail each April.

The train station offers connections to Belgrade, ƒåaƒçak, and Montenegro via the famous Belgrade‚ÄìBar railway.

cities.name: Valjevo

cities.name: Zlatibor

Art & Culture.name: Open-Air Museum 'Old Village' (Sirogojno)
Art & Culture.description: An open-air ethnographic museum showcasing traditional wooden houses, crafts, and rural life from the 19th century. It‚Äôs one of Serbia‚Äôs most visited cultural sites.

Art & Culture.name: Stopiƒáa Cave

Art & Culture.name: Mokra Gora and ≈†argan Eight Railway

Photo Spots.name: Drvengrad (Meƒáavnik)

Nature & Relaxation.description: A peaceful artificial lake just outside Zlatibor, ideal for picnics, fishing, or paddle boating.

Nature & Relaxation.name: Tornik Ski Center
Nature & Relaxation.description: The main ski and snowboard area on Zlatibor, with slopes suitable for all levels and summer activities like biking and zip-lining.

cities.local_food_tip: Don‚Äôt miss the famous Zlatibor cheese, kajmak, and smoked meat (pr≈°uta). Try homemade plum rakija and local pastries like ‚Äòkomplet lepinja.‚Äô
